title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.51 | 21-03-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chakshurunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Srimate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naramchaiva Narottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudeerayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 51st words of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Streenam Madhata Bandhunam
Droho Yosav Ihotthitaha
Karmabhir Grihamedhiyair
Naham Kalpo Vyapohitum
The meaning of this verse is
I have killed many friends of women and I have thus caused enmity to such an extent that it is not possible to undo it by material welfare work.
This is continuing from the previous few verses where Yudhishthira Maharaj after visiting the battlefield after the war was over.
His son was killed.
His son was killed.
His son was killed.
He had seen the massacre that has taken place.
He had seen the massacre that has taken place.
He had seen the massacre that has taken place.
Millions, 640 million people were dead.
And he is feeling very guilty that just for me to be enthroned as the emperor of the world, this huge killing has happened.
Therefore he is expressing his...
feelings as a conscientious devotee. This is his behavior or his reaction as a devotee.
He is assuming responsibility for killing different kinds of people as a result of
this battle. So, Srila Prabhupada explains in the purport, the Grihamedhis are those
whose only business is to perform welfare work for the sake of material prosperity.
There are two words that are used in the scriptures,
Grihamedhi and Grihastri.
Grihamedhi is a person who doesn't have any spiritual understanding of life, simply works
on the basis of I am the body and simply works for maintenance of the body, for giving pleasure
to the body, for maintaining the body and the false ego dictates that I am this body
and all the body is mine.
The bodily connections are mine. This is the outlook of a Grihamedhi and such a Grihamedhi,
whatever work he does, he does only for the sake of material gain. He has no understanding
of spiritual perspective of life itself. So, such Grihamedhis they perform welfare
activity only for the sake of material prosperity. Now, these material prosperity is sometimes
hampered by sinful activities. Why? Why is it hampered by sinful activities? Because
a materialist is sure to commit sins even unintentionally in the course of discharging
material duties. That's the nature of this material world. Even if a person,
knows what is sin and wants to avoid sinful activities he cannot avoid that simply by
being engaged in material duties
so it is said here to get relief from such sinful reactions the vedas prescribe several
kinds of sacrifices unintentionally committed sins there is a prescription in the vedas
different kinds of sacrifices are prescribed for those on the path of material gain
through the scriptural directions so further Srila Prabhupada says it is said in the vedas
that by performing the ashwamedha yagna
or horse sacrifice one can get relief from even brahma hatya killing of a brahmana
among all the types of sinful activities a person can commit in the human form of life
the most grievous type of sinful activity is this killing of a brahmana killing of a cow
and killing of a brahmana krishna is worshipped as
a brahmana hita yacha
krishna is worshipped as the topmost well-wisher of the cows and the brahmanas
the brahmanical culture human society can progress spiritually only if this brahmanical culture is
maintained
and all saintly kings raja rishis
maintain this brahmanical culture based to protect the brahmanas and cows especially
but yudhishthira maharaj thinking is different
so yudhishthira maharaj actually performed this ashwamedha yagna
in order to atone for unintentional sinful activities
but he thinks that even though by performing such yagnas one can generally become free from sinful
reactions he thinks that for him it is not possible to get relief even by performing ashwamedha yagna
from the great sins he has committed
what happens when a war takes place
shrila prabhupada explains in war either the husband or the brother or even the father or sons
go to fight when they are killed a fresh enmity is created and thus a chain of actions and reactions
increase which is not possible to be counteracted even by thousands of ashwamedha yagnas
um
in a particular battle one particular family people are killed
kshatriyas then the women are so much the surviving
family members the women and children unprotected and then there is enmity
and
um
um
Lelakshmi may be described as the first family in violence but in the great days There is that
a woman named lelaki or a woman called lelaki who is a nice lady and a very kind person
the child killed her son left her child to his mother-in-law also with her husband and his wife
the two lovers had a very good relationship and now they say that they are not sharing the battle
and that is why they say that the FX is not that they can not make it in this way
when they find out that they can not do it in their own way then the gravedigger of the vale
will say that he has no power over them and son of Yadav is again leaving them alone after their loss
become enemies of the new ruling king. Like this, this enmity continues and there is a chain of
action and reaction. So, Srila Prabhupada says the way of karma is like that.
Material activity or work in this material world is like that. We are always entangled in a chain
of action and reaction. It creates one action and another reaction simultaneously and thus
increases the chain of material activities, binding the performer in material bondage.
So, what is the way out of this chain of actions and reactions?
In the Bhagavad Gita, Srila Prabhupada says,
in the
9th chapter, 2 verses, 27th and 28th verses, the remedy is suggested that such actions and
reactions on the path of work can be checked only when work is done on behalf of the Supreme Lord.
Only by offering the work or doing the work on behalf of the Supreme Lord or offering the results of the work to Krishna,
can one be freed from the reactions.
The battle of Kurukshetra was actually fought by the will of the Supreme Lord,
Shri Krishna.
krishna as it is evident from his version that is krishna's version and only by krishna's will
was yudhishthira placed from the throne of astinapura so actually yudhishthira maharaj
is a pure devotee and it is krishna's intention that a king like yudhishthira maharaj rules the
whole world because he is the proper representative of krishna in this material world therefore
factually no sin whatsoever touched the pandavas who were only the order carriers of the lord
for the pandavas there is no sin because they are pure devotees they do everything for pleasing
krishna they do everything on behalf of krishna they carry out krishna's orders
it is this
ground in the mahabharata after the battle was over and yudhishthira maharaj was to be enthroned
he did not want to rule the the world that way but krishna wanted it therefore yudhishthira maharaj
accepted to rule the world so this is the uh real um nature of
devotee detached from everything material but for the sake of the supreme lord a devotee accepts
anything and everything for the sake of serving the lord that's the nature of a devotee
so srila prabhupada says for others that means those who are non-devotees who declare
war out of personal interest the whole responsibility lies on them that means for
those who are non-devotees when they are involved in a war in which massive killing happens they
are responsible for that killing if they have declared war out of personal whims or for their
own sake here yudhishthira maharaj tried for peace negotiation yudhishthira mara sent even krishna
to the yodana for peace negotiation
But Krishna also could not convince Duryodhana to stop this battle, to avoid this war.
So it was inevitable that Yudhishthira had to fight this battle.
And Krishna wanted it because Krishna's plan was to remove the burden of the earth.
The earth was overburdened by demoniac kings before the appearance of Krishna.
And the Pandavas appeared simply for assisting Krishna in his pastimes because they are his
pure devotees.
So Krishna reduced the burden by killing so many demons.
And finally, those demons who still remained after Krishna killing them, he gathered all
those demons.
On the battlefield of Kurukshetra.
And he wanted his pure devotees, the Pandavas to kill these demons on his behalf.
So actually the demons killed by Krishna are so much benefited that their sinful reactions
are completely nullified because being killed by Krishna.
When some demons, any demon is killed by a pure devotee, similarly the demon is purified
of all sinful reactions.
Because a pure devotee never kills anyone except on the order of Krishna.
Because a pure devotee kills somebody only on the order of Krishna, the person who is
killed even by a pure devotee is nullified, his sinful reactions are completely nullified.
So that was the end of this video.
What was the actual position of the Pandavas?
They were untouched by any reactions.
But Yudhishthira Maharaj is still continuing to think that he is responsible for the mass
killing.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
